intro: Tricholepis procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate tricholepis, is a low-growing perennial plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels. Tricholepis procumbens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
